title: Possible issue: Process isolation fails with latest Jenkins CI with Jenkins running as daemon on Ubuntu
body:
Sorry but this must be a problem with Jenkins but this may also be relevant to PHPUnit.

I've created a test project which you can clone to see the errors. 

```
git://github.com/asartalo/jenkins-ci-phpunit-test.git
```

My environment:
- Ubuntu
- Jenkins 1.441 installed by following the instructions here: http://pkg.jenkins-ci.org/debian/ (Jenkins runs as a daemon)
- PHP 5.3.6-13ubuntu3.2 with Suhosin-Patch
- PHPUnit 3.6.4

After upgrading to Jenkins 1.441 after my previous Jenkins installation (1.409.1) was crashing for some other problem, when I run builds with tests that have process isolation, I get some cryptic errors: 

```
[exec] 1) Acme\Tests\ProcessIsolationTest::testFirstProcess
     [exec] RuntimeException: Invalid arguments: no command supplied
     [exec] usage: daemon [options] [--] [cmd arg...]
     [exec] options:
     [exec] 
     [exec]       -h, --help              - Print a help message then exit
     [exec]       -V, --version           - Print a version message then exit
     [exec]       -v, --verbose[=level]   - Set the verbosity level
     [exec]       -d, --debug[=level]     - Set the debugging level
     [exec] 
     [exec]       -C, --config=path       - Specify the configuration file
     [exec]       -N, --noconfig          - Bypass the system configuration file
     [exec]       -n, --name=name         - Guarantee a single named instance
     [exec]       -X, --command=cmd       - Specify the client command as an option
     [exec]       -P, --pidfiles=/dir     - Override standard pidfile location
     [exec]       -F, --pidfile=/path     - Override standard pidfile name and location
     [exec] 
     [exec]       -u, --user=user[:group] - Run the client as user[:group]
     [exec]       -R, --chroot=path       - Run the client with path as root
     [exec]       -D, --chdir=path        - Run the client in directory path
     [exec]       -m, --umask=umask       - Run the client with the given umask
     [exec]       -e, --env="var=val"     - Set a client environment variable
     [exec]       -i, --inherit           - Inherit environment variables
     [exec]       -U, --unsafe            - Allow execution of unsafe executable
     [exec]       -S, --safe              - Deny execution of unsafe executable
     [exec]       -c, --core              - Allow core file generation
     [exec] 
     [exec]       -r, --respawn           - Respawn the client when it terminates
     [exec]       -a, --acceptable=#      - Minimum acceptable client duration (seconds)
     [exec]       -A, --attempts=#        - Respawn # times on error before delay
     [exec]       -L, --delay=#           - Delay between spawn attempt bursts (seconds)
     [exec]       -M, --limit=#           - Maximum number of spawn attempt bursts
     [exec]           --idiot             - Idiot mode (trust root with the above)
     [exec] 
     [exec]       -f, --foreground        - Run the client in the foreground
     [exec]       -p, --pty[=noecho]      - Allocate a pseudo terminal for the client
     [exec] 
     [exec]       -l, --errlog=spec       - Send daemon's error output to syslog or file
     [exec]       -b, --dbglog=spec       - Send daemon's debug output to syslog or file
     [exec]       -o, --output=spec       - Send client's output to syslog or file
     [exec]       -O, --stdout=spec       - Send client's stdout to syslog or file
     [exec]       -E, --stderr=spec       - Send client's stderr to syslog or file
     [exec] 
     [exec]           --running           - Check if a named daemon is running
     [exec]           --restart           - Restart a named daemon client
     [exec]           --stop              - Terminate a named daemon process
     [exec] 
     [exec] /usr/bin/phpunit:44
```

This didn't happen before the upgrade.

I tried this on a separate machine (Mac OS X Leopard) and ran jenkins by running the war file on terminal directly and the error did not appear:

```
$ java -jar jenkins.war
```

I would be really grateful if anyone can shed light on this issue.
